qas.question: What company ran the Marshall Islands in the late 19th century?
When did the Jaluit Gesellschaft's administration of the islands end?
Along with the Marianas and Palau, what islands were acquired from Spain in 1899?
What official administered Germany's Micronesian possessions?

answers.text: the governor of German New Guinea

context: A German trading company, <a0_0>the Jaluit Gesellschaft<a0_0/>, administered the islands from 1887 until <a1_0>1905<a1_0/>. They conscripted the islanders as laborers and mistreated them. After <a2_0>the German–Spanish Treaty of 1899<a2_0/>, in which Germany acquired <a3_0>the Carolines<a3_0/>, Palau, and the Marianas from Spain, Germany placed all of its Micronesian islands, including the Marshalls, under <a4_0>the governor of German New Guinea<a4_0/>.
